org.flexiblepower.api.efi.bufferhelper

Class BufferActuator<Q extends javax.measure.quantity.Quantity>

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.flexiblepower.api.efi.bufferhelper.BufferActuator<Q>
  • Type Parameters:
    Q - The quantity type of the buffer

    public class BufferActuator<Q extends javax.measure.quantity.Quantity>
extends java.lang.Object
    The BufferActuator that integrates updated EFI messages and provides additional methods.

    • Constructor Detail

      • BufferActuator

        public BufferActuator(Actuator ac,
              Buffer<Q> parentBuffer)
        Constructs a BufferActuator from the Actuator information in a message. The BufferActuator persists so that any updates to the actuator can be integrated in this single object.
        Parameters:
        ac - The Actuator's initial information.
        parentBuffer - The Parent Buffer (to gain access to the fill level).

        public boolean hasRunningMode(int rmId)
        Returns whether the RunningMode id is valid for this actuator.
        Parameters:

        Returns:

      • getReachableRunningModes

        public java.util.Collection<RunningMode<FillLevelFunction<RunningModeBehaviour>>> getReachableRunningModes(java.util.Date now)
                                                                                                    throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Returns the reachableRunning modes including the current one, if it may stay in it. Returns the empty set if it has not yet received enough information(All EFI messages including BufferStateUpdate message).
        Parameters:
        now - The current time.
        Returns:
        The reachable running modes including the current one.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - When an unknown running mode id is returned from the reachable running modes.

      • getReachableRunningModeIds

        public java.util.Set<java.lang.Integer> getReachableRunningModeIds(java.util.Date now)
        Returns the reachableRunning mode ids including the current one, if it may stay in it. Returns the empty set if it has not yet received enough information (All EFI messages including BufferStateUpdate message).
        Parameters:
        now - The current time.
        Returns:
        The reachable running mode ids including the current one.

        Returns the commodities that this actuator is able to use as either input or output.
        Returns:

      • updateTimer

        public void updateTimer(int timerId,
               java.util.Date finishedAt)
        Upon receiving an update, the end time of the given timer is updated.
        Parameters:
        timerId - The id of the timer.
        finishedAt - The new finishedAt time that overwrites the old one.

      • getPossibleDemands

        public java.util.List<javax.measure.Measurable<javax.measure.quantity.Power>> getPossibleDemands(java.util.Date moment,
                                                                                        double fillLevel)
                                                                                          throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Gets the electrical demands of all reachable RunningModes at this moment including the current one, given this fill level of the buffer. It returns an empty list when there has not been a state update.
        Parameters:
        moment - The moment of interest.
        fillLevel - The buffer's current fill level expressed as a value where 0 is the minimum and 1 is the maximum. Its unit is the agreed upon unit.
        Returns:
        An unordered list of the possible electricity consumption demands of the RunningModes, possibly including running modes with the same power demand. For fill levels outside the defined minimum and maximum range, the minimum and maximum value is returned.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - When a FillLevelFunction of a reachable state has no range elements.

      • getMinimumFillLevel

        public double getMinimumFillLevel()
                           throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Gets the minimum fill level of the buffer actuator expressed in the agreed upon unit.
        Returns:
        The minimum fill level of the buffer actuator.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - Thrown when no running mode is known yet and a minimum fill level is requested.

      • getMaximumFillLevel

        public double getMaximumFillLevel()
                           throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Gets the maximum fill level of the buffer actuator expressed in the agreed upon unit.
        Returns:
        The maximum fill level of the buffer actuator.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - Thrown when no running mode is known yet and a maximum fill level is requested.
